personal_projects.name: 2048 Clone
personal_projects.description: This was just a quick challenge whilst travelling to Paris on the train. I completed this on the return journey and managed it without any internet connection!

personal_projects.name: Snake 3D
personal_projects.description:
ThreeJS recreation of a Snake Game.
I used this as a project to learn the basics of ThreeJS.
I would like to implement proper 3D models and complete the gameplay features in future.

personal_projects.name: YouTube Playlist Length
personal_projects.description:
Displays the total duration of the current YouTube playlist, released on the Chrome Extension store with 300 users as of 16/05/23.
I used this to learn how to build a Chrome Extension and the release process, but continue to maintain it.

personal_projects.name: Island Terrain Generator
personal_projects.description:
Small app that uses 2D noise algorithms to generate random island terrains.
This was a good exercise in code optimization.
I'd like to use this to generate 3D terrains in future.

personal_projects.name: 2D Raycasting Demo
personal_projects.description:
A 2D app built with P5.js where a light source follows the mouse and the user can draw 'walls'to block the light.
I built this to learn how raycasting works in computer graphics.
In future I'd like to utilize this logic in a game of some form.

personal_projects.name: Task Management React App
personal_projects.description:
A task management app inspired by apps like 'Trello'.
I used this to learn the basics of ReactJS.
In future I would like to improve the appearance of the app and make a conversion using Reactstate Hooks.

personal_projects.name: Draw Race 2D
personal_projects.description: *Warning* this is a very old project I started to work on again, so is currently rough! Place points to create a racetrack, then see it generated and ready to drive on.

personal_projects.name: Cat API Snap!
personal_projects.description:
A small snap game, where the images are randomly fetched cats from a Cat API.
This was an exercise in using an external API.
More details are below the game itself.

personal_projects.name: This Portfolio Site
personal_projects.description:
Built to be simple, this portfolio site generates these work items from data stored in a JSON file, and uses only pure HTML, CSS, and JS.
I'm a programmer at heart, not a designer, so I decided to scrap any attempt at a better looking portfolio site in favour of simple functionality!

uni_projects.name: FYP: Real Streets Track Generator
uni_projects.description:
My Final Year Project - An application to generate a 3D racetrack scene based upon a real-life route selected by the user.
This was built with ThreeJS with Mapbox as the data provider.

uni_projects.name: Attendance Register Web App
uni_projects.description:
A Group Project part of the 'Software Architecture & Design' final year module where I acted as a team lead.
It is a full MERN stack application which implements a secure user account system, roles, attendance registering, and stat tracking.

uni_projects.name: Asteroids Enhanced
uni_projects.description:
A Second Year project for the 'Object-oriented Programming' module.
This is a game based on the classic 'Asteroids', written in C++ with a university-created OpenGL graphics library, it aims to implement pure OOP.

uni_projects.name: SciToolset Mission Viewer
uni_projects.description:
A Second Year project for the 'Group Software Dev Project' module which I led the development of.
Built with plain HTML, CSS & JS, this is a dataset visualizer for a real client 'SciToolset', it displays data supplied by their API (currently mocked) and lets the user view stats, filter, and tag the data.

uni_projects.name: JWPL - Custom Programming Language
uni_projects.description:
A Second Year project for the 'Fundamentals of Programming Languages' module, where I designed a programming language from scratch.
Part 1 of the project was to design the grammar for the language which I based on markdown, using Antlr to parse it.
Part 2 involved using Java to create an interpreter and Javascript compiler to run the code.

uni_projects.name: Meeting Scheduler
uni_projects.description:
A Second Year project for the 'Software Engineering: Concepts & methods' module.
Leading the development side of the group, I created a meeting scheduler application with C# and Winforms which allows users to create & edit meetings, accept invited from others, and request special equipment.

uni_projects.name: Follow Me Game
uni_projects.description:
A First Year project for the 'C++ Programming' module.
A game created in C++ with a university-written OpenGL Graphics Library, where the player must copy the randomly generated moves of the computer with increasing difficulty, with full 2D graphics, scoreboard and sound effects.
